tool.name: DownloadImgColbyTag
tool.displayname: Download Image Collection by Asset Tag

param.name: ic_asset_tag
param.displayname: Specify GEE Image Collection Asset Tag
param.dialogReference: The asset tag could be found at the dataset information page. For example, “ee.ImageCollection('COPERNICUS/S2_SR')” loads the Google Earth Engine Image Collection by asset tag "COPERNICUS/S2_SR".

param.name: filter_dates
param.dialogReference:
The user can filter the image collection by starting and ending dates. The typical formats of date strings are listed below.

  1. Year only, '2020'

  2. Year and month, '2020-07'

  3. Year, month and date, '2020-07-01'

  4. Year, month, date, and time, '2020-07-05T06:34:46'

For more information, please visit https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/apidocs/ee-imagecollection-filterdate

param.name: filter_bounds
param.dialogReference: Filter a collection by intersection with point geometry. Items in the collection with a footprint that fails to intersect the given geometry will be excluded.

param.name: use_centroid
param.displayname: Use the center of the current map view extent
param.dialogReference: Use the centroid of the current map view as the point geometry.

param.name: img_list
param.dialogReference: The filtered images will be listed here. The user can select multiple images to download.

param.name: bands
param.dialogReference: The image dataset could contain multiple bands. Select the target bands to download. The user can select as many as needed.

param.name: scale
param.dialogReference: Specify the scale of the downloaded GeoTIFF in meters. The default scale uses the maximum scale among the selected bands.

param.name: in_poly
param.displayname: Choose a polygon as region of interest
param.dialogReference: Choose a polygon feature layer as the region of interest to download the GeoTIFF. The image will be clipped by the polygon extent.

param.name: use_extent
param.displayname: Use the current map view extent as region of interest
param.dialogReference: Check this box if using the current map extent as the region of interest.

param.name: out_folder
param.dialogReference: Specify the full path of the output folder to store the GeoTIFF files. One image per GeoTIFF file. Each GeoTIFF file is automatically named with the image collection asset tag and the image id.

param.name: load_tiff
param.displayname: Load images to map after download
param.dialogReference: Check this box if the user wants to load the output GeoTIFF file to the current map after download.

tool.summary: This script downloads the Earth Engine image collection dataset to GeoTIFF by its asset tag. It converts Earth Engine image collection object to xarray dataset using 'xee' and writes to local GeoTIFF file using 'rasterio'. Theoretically, there is no file size limitation compared to other functions such as ee.Image.getDownloadURL() and ee.data.getPixels(). Larger files will take longer to download.

idCitation.resTitle: Download Image Collection by Asset Tag
